meanings.definition: The point or position at an equal distance from the edges or ends of something.
meanings.sent1: She placed the toy car in the middle of the room.
meanings.sent2: The cake had chocolate frosting in the middle layer.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat in the middle of the dog bed, claiming it as her own.
meanings.sent4: The middle of the storm was calm, surrounded by chaos.
meanings.sent5: The middle of the forest was filled with tall trees and chirping birds.

meanings.definition: The central part or point of something.
meanings.sent1: The middle of the movie was the most exciting part.
meanings.sent2: The middle of the sandwich had extra cheese.
meanings.sent3: The middle of the argument was when they both started laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the warm middle of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The middle of the maze held the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: To place in the center or between two things.
meanings.sent1: She asked him to middle the vase between the candles.
meanings.sent2: He decided to middle the chair between the two windows.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to middle the sauce just right for the dish.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to middle the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to middle the colors to create a harmonious painting.
